intro: Dampiera angulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and bloom during the spring and summer months. Dampiera angulata is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
